post_content:
View this post on Instagram

🗣Recipe Time🗣 . Pork Chop Marsala🔥🔥🔥 . Served this with some Roasted Broccolini and Cauliflower Mash. (Trying to keep the carbs low this week! Quarantine Weight Gain is real 😂😂😂) . Ingredients: 2-4 boneless pork chops 1 cup all purpose flour 1/4 cup olive oil (or Avocado) 8 oz porcini or bella mushrooms 1/2 cup marsala wine 1/2 cup chicken stock 1/4 cup heavy cream 1 tbs minced garlic 1 diced shallot 3 tbs butter 1 tbs chicken base salt, pepper, garlic, onion powder chopped parsley 1 tsp browning (optional for darker color, as needed) . Directions: Using a meat tenderizer, flatten the pork chops until they are even (about 1/4 inch thick) – You can place them between some plastic wrap and flatten them. Season the chops with salt, pepper, garlic, onion powder. Add flour to mixing bowl and season with salt and pepper. Lightly coat the pork chops with flour and set aside while you get your pan hot. Heat oil in large skillet and add 2 tbs butter. Add pork chops and fry for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Remove the chops to a plate for later. Reduce heat to medium and add in mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Season as you go. Cook this mixture for 3-4 minutes until the mushrooms are nicely browned. Pour in the marsala and increase heat to bring to a boil. Allow the alcohol to cook off a bit. Reduce heat to a simmer and add in chicken stock and cream. Add in remaining butter and mix together. Season as needed and add your chops back to the sauce. Baste with sauce and mushrooms and cover and cook until the pork chops hit 160 internal . Cooked in my @lodgecastiron skillet.. chicken base —> @betterthanbouillon -> chops @crowdcow (use code “makeithappen” for discount!) . #pork #porkchops #friedporkchops #smothered #chickenmarsala #dinnertime #easyrecipe #weeknightmeals #letseat #menthatcook #ichef #mrmakeithappen #foodies #foodlover #porkonyourfork #porkchop #recipeoftheday #cookingvideo #recipevideo #dinnerinspo #hungryaf

A post shared by Mr. Make It Happen (Matt) (@_mrmakeithappen_) on Apr 23, 2020 at 12:42pm PDT

The lively sauce makes for the perfect gravy, adding a burst of flavors to the chewy chops. Besides its incredible taste and superfast prep time, the dish looks quite attractive, as summed up by @_mrmakeithappen_.

Gone are the days when you could blame your schedule for skipping meals. From Buffalo wings to pasta, here are 15 dishes to quickly satisfy your hunger.

With some intricate dishes demanding care and patience in equal measure, cooking against the clock can be a serious challenge. These time-consuming recipes are not for those who prefer quick and easy meals without too much hassle. Fortunately, some cracking, delicious foods can be easily prepared without violating the rules of the minute-hand. These meals are also fairly easy to cook and require minimal ingredients. Ready within 15 minutes tops, here are the 15 delicious dishes everyone should know of.

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Birthday girl’s favorite dinner tonight - spaghetti with shrimp cooked in a light olive oil, garlic - lemon sauce that gets its richness from the starchy pasta water. While the pasta is cooking, sauté on low heat minced garlic and green onions in olive oil. When they soften after a couple mins, add the shrimp and season with salt, black pepper and crushed red pepper. Toss the shrimp after 2 mins and then squeeze the juice from an entire lemon. Stir to combine. By this time spaghetti should be al dente. Save 2-3 large ladles of pasta water and drain. Transfer spaghetti to the pan with shrimp. Spoon the pasta water, 1 ladle at a time. Toss well to combine everything and cook for 2 mins. Take it off the heat and serve garnished with minced parsley and grated Parmesan on top! #signatureconcoctions #pasta #lemonsauce #15minutemeals

A post shared by 𝗩𝗮𝘀𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗶| 𝑆𝑖𝑔𝑛𝑎𝑡𝑢𝑟𝑒 𝖢𝗈𝗇𝖼𝗈𝖼𝗍𝗂𝗈𝗇𝗌 (@signatureconcoctions) on Jan 31, 2020 at 8:56pm PST

An ultimate time-saver and super tasty, shrimps are just perfect with creamy sauce. This dish by @signatureconcoctions looks light and is abundant with intense garlic flavors. Depending on your choice, the spaghetti can be replaced with rice or garlic bread.

Creamy Tuscan Chicken 🍗 TAG A FRIEND WHO WOULD LOVE THIS!! 😍 - If you enjoy the content, please consider hitting the Follow button to support us! Stay Healthy peeps!🌈⁣ 🥑@caloriesescape ⁣ 🥑@caloriesescape ⁣ 🥑@caloriesescape ⁣ - INGREDIENTS (for 4 servings) 4 bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs 2 teaspoons salt, for the chicken 1 teaspoon pepper, for the chicken 1 tablespoon oil 3 cloves garlic, chopped ½ onion, diced 1 tomato, diced 2 cups spinach (80 g) 2 cups heavy cream (480 mL) 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon pepper ½ cup grated parmesan cheese (55 g) 2 tablespoons fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped . INSTRUCTIONS Season the chicken all over with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-low heat. Place the chicken thighs skin side down in the skillet and cook for about 13 minutes to crisp up the skin. Move the chicken around from time to time to ensure it cooks evenly. The skin should be hard to the touch. Flip the chicken, then cook for about another 15 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. Remove from pan. Add the garlic and onion, stirring until onions are translucent. Stir in the tomatoes and spinach until the spinach is wilted. Add the heavy cream, salt, and pepper, bringing to a boil. Add the Parmesan cheese and parsley, stirring until the sauce has thickened slightly. Place the chicken back in the pan, spooning the sauce on top of the chicken. Enjoy! By: Alvin Zhou and Tasty #healthyfood⁣ #healthyfoodadvice ⁣ #healthydinner #healthycooking #veggierecipes #veggies #eattherainbow #balancedmeal #healthyrecipes #breakfastbowl #lowcaloriemeals #healthybreakfast #healthydinners #healthylunch #healthyideas #quickmeals #healthydinnerideas #postworkoutmeal #mealprepping #homemademeals #nutritiousanddelicious

Wow! #wingwednesday #brewdog recipe wings tonight with a wee #elvisjuice in the Scottish sunshine tonight. Recipe Sauce 150ml #franksredhot buffalo wing sauce 50g butter 2 tbsp honey Heat up in a pot. Wings Soak in buttermilk for an hour or overnight. Dredge in gluten-free self raising flour, I didn't have any so used a 50/50 mix of rice flour and plain. Deep fry at 180 for 5-7 minutes per batch. Toss wings in sauce. #aberdeenfood #wings #buffalowings #fakeaway #sexyfood

post_content:
View this post on Instagram

Ginger noodle soup w/ cauliflower leaves 🥬 #nowaste ♻ These are some of my all time fave ingredients PLUS the delicious and humble cauliflower leaf. Never to be thrown away again! I love to roast cauliflower leaves or stir fry them & like here, add them to broths and stews like you would cabbage. In the picture, I’ve used up my leftover roast chicken but if you love mushrooms, swap for mushrooms. This takes 15 minutes and is exactly what you want this week. More green soups coming up soon ✔️ Ginger noodle soup w/ cauliflower leaves Serves 2, takes 15 minutes 160g soba (buckwheat) noodles The leftover leaves from a cauliflower, roughly sliced vertically if ginormous or if the stems are very thick 1/2 tbsp coconut oil 2cm piece of ginger, finely chopped or finely grated 2 garlic cloves, finely chopped 1 bunch of spring onions, sliced 600ml quality veg or chicken broth or stock 2 handfuls of spinach or kale/cabbage, chopped 200g shiitake mushrooms, roughly sliced or 1 handful of leftover roast chicken Sea salt & pepper 2 tbsp tamari, to taste Chilli flakes/ chilli paste/ fresh chilli to taste Squeeze of lemon or lime METHOD 1. Gently fry the ginger and garlic with most of the spring onions in coconut oil for 5 minutes, stirring from time to time. (Save the rest of the spring onions for the end) 2. Meanwhile in a second pan, cook the noodles according to packet instructions & give them 30 seconds less than instructed then rinse them in cold water and set aside. 3. If you’re using the mushrooms, add them to the first pan for a few minutes. Then add the stock/broth, pop the lid on and bring to the boil the immediately turn down to a medium simmer & add the cauliflower leaves. 4. If you’re using kale, add them to the pan now too but if you’re adding spinach, add it once the cauliflower leaves are tender after about 3-5 minutes. If you’re adding leftover chicken, add with the cauliflower leaves so the chicken is heated all the way through. 5. Season with tamari, lemon juice & sea salt & pepper plus chilli if using. Add the noodles, taste for seasoning & serve straight away, topping with the last of the spring onions

A post shared by Melissa Hemsley 🌱feelgood food (@melissa.hemsley) on Jan 15, 2019 at 4:20am PST

Need to get rid of the spinach and kale stocked in your fridge? Add them to this super delicious and healthy ginger noodle soup. You can add quite a few veggies, just like @melissa.hemsley did.
